gurmukhi: Ab mo qy eyeI ijix jweI ] kih muin moih kQw smJweI ]
transliteration: Ab Mo Te Eijin(i) Jaaee|| Kah(i) Mounndi) Mohe Kathaa Samjhaaee||
translation: “Now they will not go away from me, O sage ! describe them to me with clarity;

gurmukhi: Ab mY dyK bnwvO icKw ] pYTO bIc Agin kI isKw ]125]352]
transliteration: Ab Mai Dekh Banaavau Chikhaa|| Paithau Beech Agad(i) Kisikhaa||125||352||
translation: “Now I prepare my own funeral pyre within your view, and sit within the fire-flames.”125.352.

gurmukhi: icKw bnwie Snwnih krw ] sB qn bsqR iqlonw Drw ]
transliteration: Chikhaa Banaae Shanaanah(i) Karaa|| Sabh Tan Bastra Tilonaa Dharaa||
translation: After preparing the funeral pyre, he took bath and wore the garments of deep orange colour on his body;

gurmukhi: bhu ibiD log htik kir rhw ] ctpt kir crnn BI ghw ]126]353]
transliteration: Bahu Bidh(i) Log Hatak(i) Kar(i) Rahaa|| Chatpat Kar(i) Charnan Bhigadaa||126||353||
translation: Many people forbade him and even fell at his feet.126.353.

gurmukhi: hIr cIr dY ibDvq dwnw ] m`iD ktws krw AsQwnw ]
transliteration: Heer Cheer Dai Bidhvat Daanaa|| Madhh(i) Kataas Karaa Asthaanaa||
translation: Giving in charity various types of ornaments and garments, the king prepared a seat within the pyre;

gurmukhi: BwNq Aink qn jÍwl jrweI ] jrq n BeI jÍwl sIArweI ]127]354]
transliteration: Bhaant Anik Tan Jvaal Jaraaee|| Jarat Na Bhaijvaal Seearaaee||127||354||
translation: He burnt his body with various kinds of fires, but the flames became cold instead of burning him.127.354.

gurmukhi: kir kop pwrs rwie ] kr Awp Agin jrwie ] so BeI sIql jÍwl ] Aiq kwl rUp krwl ]128]355]
transliteration: Kar(i) Kop Paaras Raae|| Kar Aap Agad(i) Jaraae|| So Bhaiseetal Jvaal|| At(i) Kaal Roop Karaal||128||355||
translation: Getting infuriated, Parasnath burnt the fire in his hand, which was dreadful in sight, but became cold there.128.355.

gurmukhi: qb jog Agin inkwir ] Aiq jÍlq rUp Apwir ] qb kIAs Awpn dwh ] pur lKq Swhn Swh ]129]356]
transliteration: Tab Jog Agad(i) Nidaar(i)|| At(i) Jvalat Roop Adaar(i) Tab Kee-as Aapan Daah|| Pru Lakhat Shaahan Shaah||129||356||
translation: Then he got emerged the Yoga-fire, which was burning dreadfully; he killed himself with that fire and the people of the city continued to see that great king.129.356.

gurmukhi: qb jrI Agin ibsyK ] qiRn kwsH iGrq AsyK ] qb jrXo qwmih rwie ] Bey Bsm AdBuq kwie ]130]357]
transliteration: Tab Jariagad(i) Bisekh|| Trin Kaasat Ghirat Asekh|| Tab Daryo Taamah(i) Raae|| Bhae Bhasam Adbbout Kaae||130||357||
translation: Then with many grass-blades, the faggots alongwith ghee (clarified butter), the flames of fire arose, in which the king was burnt and his body was reduced to ashes.130.357.

gurmukhi: keI dXos brK pRmwn ] s`l jrw jor mhwn ] BeI BUq BsmI dyh ] Dn Dwm CwfXo nyh ]131]158]
transliteration: Kaidyos Barakh Pramaan|| Sall Jaraa Jor Mahaan|| Bhaibhoot Bhasamideh|| Dhan Dhaam Chhaadyo Neh||131||358||
translation: That pyre continued to burn for several years, when the body of the king was reduced to ashes and he abandoned the attachment of wealth and place.131.358.

transliteration: Ik Oankaar Sri Waheguroo Ji Ki Fateh||
translation: The Lord is One the Victory is of the Lord.
